snippet: Demand for expensive waterfront properties has the industry punch-drunk with enthusiasm. But how sustainable — and healthy — is this recent boomlet?
abstract: Demand for expensive housing in Miami is skyrocketing, as brokers scramble to find unique properties for South Americans and other foreign buyers who need a safe haven for cash; trend belies fact that the lower end of the market remains sluggish and prone to foreclosure; some observers wonder whether another bubble is afoot in the city.
lead_paragraph: Demand for expensive waterfront properties has the industry punch-drunk with enthusiasm. But how sustainable — and healthy — is this recent boomlet?

headline.print_headline: In Miami, Wondering About a Bubble
headline.seo: Big Deal — In Miami, Wondering About a Bubble
headline.main: In Miami, Wondering About a Bubble
